attributes.action: Don't call a second Scottish independence referendum
attributes.additional_details:
On the 24th of June 2016 the United Kingdom voted to leave the European Union. Yes, Scotland voted to remain but even with the SNPs double lock majority we would be leaving anyway (Wales, England and Cornwall) voted to leave which means a majority of the home nations wanted to leave. 

We need as the United Kingdom to respect the wishes of the majority of British Citizens and exit the EU and stabilise the economy and trade, then if there still is demand for Scotish independence then call it.
attributes.background: On the 24th of June 2016 the United Kingdom voted to leave the European Union. Yes, Scotland voted to remain but even with the SNPs double lock majority we would be leaving anyway (Wales, England and Cornwall) voted to leave which means a majority of the home nations wanted to leave.

rejection.details:
We think the following petition is similar to yours:
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/134361
